Hunters Worsley are elated to launch to the market this detached family home set over four floors, packed full of original features and has a spectacular view of Worsley Golf Course. This property is not to be missed as it is located on one of the most sought after roads in Monton Village. To the ground floor, there are three large reception rooms including a conservatory extension, a kitchen overlooking the golf course and a downstairs shower room. There is also access to the basement which can be used for multiple purposes including utility space/sauna room.To the first floor, there are four bedrooms, all with fitted wardrobes and a three piece family bathroom. There is also a garage/outbuilding which has plenty of potential to be converted into a separate apartment with power/plumbing/foul drain already in the building.Transport links in the area are second to none with motorway networks close by such as M602/M60/M62/M61 so you can quickly be anywhere in the North West. More locally, there are excellent public transport links with bus routes from Monton Road & Patricroft Train Station within walking distance which will have you at Manchester Victoria within 15 minutes. Monton is also twenty minutes drive from open countryside, and less than two hours drive from each of three National Parks.In recent years, Monton Village has established itself as a prime location for both young and established professionals and growing families. Boasting a variety of amenities, Monton plays host to a number of restaurants, gin bars, craft ale houses, independent retailers through to popular well-known high street supermarkets.The picturesque Roe Green Loopline Heritage Trail is famed for its wildlife. This old railway line conversion is a circular walk that begins and ends in Monton village, returning along the towpath of the Bridgewater Canal. The walk is about two miles long and gives you a glimpse of a bygone era.Between the canal and the Loopline you’ll find Duke’s Drive, a green oasis in the centre of Monton and the perfect place from which to explore the surrounding area and a lovely spot to stop off for a picnic.

THE STORY OF CEPHAS LINNEY  Cephas Linney hales from the Victorian period and was a notable character in the Heaton Mersey community. He was a coal merchant, removals specialist and well respected philanthropist. His gravestone resides in the Congregational church near to where he once lived.  A local pictorial history book shows the houses that Cephas built with his brother on Mersey Road. They had adjacent semi's and proudly named them Mersey Villas, completed in 1892 as the date stone declares and were the first homes to be built on that side of Mersey Road.  The area has changed and Mersey Road is now an eclectic mix of charming family homes, within the prized Conservation area, that are so sought after. Cephas would be delighted to see his home today where the character still prevails with the sash windows in abundance and the cornices, picture rails and ornamental bosses still in all their glory.  Today the corner plot tells a different story; the old stables have gone, replaced with elegant new homes, but the drive retains the cobbles that once carried Cephas' coal over them. It is also a three storey home these days with an additional en-suite split level bedroom with adjacent dressing area to add to a beautiful first floor bedroom with feature fireplace, another double bedroom with yet another fireplace and generous rear fourth bedroom. Downstairs there is a stunning lounge with another sumptuous cast iron open fireplace, then a superb fitted kitchen with integrated Neff appliances and large island with granite worktops, a dining room, utility room and WC. To complete the picture there are three cellar chambers with good head height with heat, light and power. The corner garden plot has been landscaped with Indian stone split level patio area, pet and child friendly artificial turf, the original cobbled area which can provide off road car parking and a bespoke garden studio in anthracite grey which is fully double glazed and insulated with light and power.  Its versatility means it could  be used as a home office, playroom or as per its current arrangement a delightful gym.Mersey Villas is within walking distance of Priestnall Secondary, St Johns, Didsbury Road and St Winifred's primary schools, Heaton Mersey Common with its 11.5 acres of woodland and the village centre.  The international airport, main London to Manchester rail line, the Metrolink and the motorway network are all a short drive away.Altogether a delightful family home, a little piece of local history and a super addition to the marketplace.  THE ACCOMMODATION COMPRISES   GROUND FLOOR   STORM PORCH  Original tiled floor. ENTRANCE HALL 13' 6" x 3' 11" (4.11m x 1.19m) Half glazed front door with glazed panels above. No1 Castlefield will sit proudly at an exciting new gateway to Manchester city centre providing 419 stylish apartments which will appeal to investors and homebuyers alike.This landmark development  will help signpost the south west approach to the city, benefiting from the close proximity to the Cornbrook Metrolink Interchange where plans are being drawn up for a world class transformation of the area.The red brick façade of street facing apartments at our new development respectfully complements the scale and appearance of the neighbouring buildings while the site is sympathetically framed by a 16 storey tower at the rear, crowned with private roof terraces. Broad passageways are formed between the surrounding four blocks providing a sense of space and access to attractive courtyards. A striking aspect of the development is the innovative rooftop houses with their private terraces and access to landscaped gardens.Stepping inside, the interiors are designed to meet the expectations of today's city living with a consistent and stylish contemporary approach which will appeal across the range of homes on offer.No1 Castlefield is a desirable new development which reflects the continuing growth and confidence within the city and offers all the advantages that easy access to its attractions can bring.No1 Castlefield offers an appealing choice of accommodation comprising one, two and three bedroom apartments, two and three bedroom duplexes, and top floor duplex penthouses with roof gardens are a feature of the development. The distinctive rooftop houses offer a modern take on the traditional terraces in the area.  The accommodation is spread across four attractive blocks including the signature tower. This carefully designed internal space, formed with glass, allows a sense of the outdoors all year round - and, when the weather's fine, sliding panels enable you to feel the sun on your face.The scheme also allows for 138 underground parking spaces, with commercial units providing active street frontages. All apartments will be hallmarked by the clean, contemporary lines and attractive living spaces that distinguish our developments. Quality fittings and fine finishes combine seamlessly to provide a real sense of coming home, while our trademark commitment to outdoor space means that every resident has the opportunity to get out, relax and unwind.THE LOCATION:Castlefield is an inner city oasis of quaint cobbled streets, canals and waterside al fresco wining and dining. Britain's first Urban Heritage Park - with its attractive canal basin, open spaces, converted mills, bridges and viaducts - has become one of the city's most sought-after residential areas. It is particularly popular with professionals who combine the undoubted lifestyle benefits with close proximity to the city centre and excellent road and rail access.  With a heritage dating back to Roman times, Castlefield today offers vibrant, modern waterside living, complemented by appealing bars, restaurants, music and entertainment.  Among the attractions are the celebrated Castlefield Bowl outdoor arena, The Castlefield Gallery and the popular Museum of Science and Industry.Castlefield is quite simply a haven at the heart of the city offering a more relaxed pace of life - but you can be sure that, when the bright lights of the city centre beckon, yoU always be close at hand.

Newly Refurbished Throughout*Large Sweeping Driveway*Beautifully Presented Rear Garden With Your Very Own Bridge!*Downstairs W.C.*En Suite To Bedroom One*Separate Utility/Store Room*Living Room with Bi-Fold Door our to Rear GardenA unique detached property comes to the market which will be like no other you see before.  It is generously spaced throughout and comes with all the facilities and mod cons you would hope for, ideal for family living.As you walk on to the grounds the property is surrounded by a sweeping driveway, able to accommodate numerous cars.  You enter the property through a porch leading in to a charactful hallway which has a cloakroom and downstairs WC.  From here you walk through in to the large open plan Kitchen/Dining/Living space, ideal for entertaining guests and a main family room.  The room is bright and airy with light coming in from three sides and views. The kitchen comes fitted with high spec appliances including a dishwasher.  From the lounge you have scenic views across the rear garden which you can walk straight in to from the bi-folding doors.The downstairs also benefits from a large utility/store room as well as a large second reception room with feature fireplace. Outside to the rear of the property you have a private rear garden which is a botanical dream.  There is a patio area ideal for the Summer BBQ and furniture and then you are presented with a bridge leading across your very own brooke! The bridge leads across to a secret garden with seating area and Austrian doll house, which must be viewed to be appreciated.Upstairs continues with the bright and spacious theme with a feature window in the landing.  There are three double bedrooms with bedroom one having a full ensuite with shower and WC. A further single bedroom and a brand new bathroom with bath and overhead shower.   There is also a useful storage cupboard and extra storage in the loft which has a drop down ladder access.The property is located ideally with local supermarkets just a few minutes drive away.  You are also located opposite Wythenshawe Park which has a petting zoo, coffee shop and horse riding lessons and more!  The property  is also just a short drive to Manchester Airport, and the M60 Motorway.Call the number 24/7 or book online to request a viewing.Additional Information:Council Tax: Band EMarketed by EweMove Sales & Lettings (Didsbury) - Property Reference 44946

A fantastic detached family home which is located on a quiet cul de sac within strolling distance to Heaton Moor & Heaton Mersey Village's, close to an abundance of amenities, transport links and local schools. This extended and well-presented home stands on a larger than average plot and briefly comprises: Entrance Porch with storage, entrance hallway leading into a spacious lounge and bar area, dining room leading into a family sitting room. A stunning open plan kitchen with family room and views over the private enclosed rear garden, downstairs shower room with sauna and separate utility room with access to the rear garden. To the first floor there are four double bedrooms, master having a separate dressing room and en-suite plus a family bathroom with a four piece suite. Externally the property benefits from off road parking to the front with attractive lawned garden, to the rear, a beautiful landscaped garden with large lawn area and well stocked plant beds plus patio areas suitable for garden furniture. An internal inspection of this fantastic family home is highly recommended.

Situated in a fantastic location close to local amenities, schools and transport links, this fantastic property boasts spacious accommodation throughout. The property has been recently refurbished to a high standard by the current owner and briefly comprises:  A bright welcoming hallway, spacious living room, dining room with patio doors leading out onto a covered decking area. A stunning new kitchen with breakfast bar and high end appliances with a rear door leading out onto a large enclosed garden. To the first floor, a light and spacious landing leading to four generous bedrooms plus a new modern family bathroom with separate WC. The property also has the added benefit of ample off road parking to the front plus a single garage. To the rear a private enclosed garden with a patio area and lawned garden. Viewing highly recommended to appreciate this stunning home.

A STUNNING FAMILY HOME, with IMMACULATELY PRESENTED and SPACIOUS accommodation over THREE FLOORS, benefiting from an ATTRACTIVE REAR GARDEN and allocated GATED PARKING to the rear, located within the ALBERT PARK CONSERVATION AREA, and walking distance to cosmopolitan Burton Road and West Didsbury village. 1849 sq ft. The accommodation consists of an entrance hallway with WC, living room and family dining kitchen with patio doors to the rear. The upper floors reveals six well proportioned bedrooms being served by a bathroom and two en suite shower rooms. Externally is a landscaped rear garden and secure allocated parking.A magnificent family home with beautifully presented, bright and spacious accommodation extending to an impressive 1849 sq ft, located within the Albert Park Conservation Area and strolling distance from cosmopolitan West Didsbury village as well as being within the catchment area for local reputable schools.The accommodation consists of an entrance hallway with stairs to the first floor and a downstairs WC. There is a generously sized living room flooded with natural light via the south easterly facing square bay window and benefits from a feature gas fireplace and double doors leading through to the family dining kitchen which has patio doors accessing the garden and ample space for a table and chairs, suitable for family dining and entertaining. The kitchen is fitted with a comprehensive range of modern wall and base level units with space for a range cooker, American style fridge/freezer and white goods. The first floor reveals four well-proportioned bedrooms, including two doubles, with the two larger than average. This floor is served by a stylish family bathroom providing a bath, separate shower, wash basin and WC.The second floor reveals a further two spacious double bedrooms, both benefiting from ample fitted wardrobes and en suite shower rooms with the front bedroom having double doors opening to a small balcony and the rear bedroom having a useful walk in storage cupboard.Externally there is an attractive rear garden, mainly laid to lawn with a patio area suitable for al fresco dining and entertaining. A gate provides access to the gated car park to the rear providing allocated off road parking for 2 cars.

A striking and brand-new development of four individually designed properties known as 'Lawn Drive'.  An attractive scheme built by MAI construction here in South Manchester.  Located in a prime position in Whalley Range.  A modern way of living with open plan accommodation leading out into a lawned rear garden with timber panelled fencing, complimented by the highest specification and standards to create four outstanding new FREEHOLD homes. Each home offers well planned accommodation over three floors and comprises; vestibule, entrance hall, a downstairs W.C, lounge to the front aspect and an impressive open plan fully fitted kitchen/dining/family room to the ground floor with bi-folding doors out into the rear enclosed lawned garden.  Whilst the first floor reveals a landing with a hot water tank cupboard, three double bedrooms, bedroom to the front aspect benefits from a beautifully fitted white three-piece shower room and a stunning fitted three-piece family bathroom.  The second floor reveals a landing with a Velux window to the front aspect, an impressive master bedroom with a three-piece ensuite shower and a dressing area/office space.The houses benefit from aluminium double glazing, an alarm system, wall mounted security lights, communal electric car charging point, gas fired central heating, 10-year build warranty, a tarmacadam driveway for all residents leading to a private driveway providing off road parking for two vehicles, front and rear enclosed lawned gardens.  A monthly service of £50pcm.  Total size: 165 m2 (1,800 sq ft). Within a fifteen-minute walk of boutique Chorlton village that provides a lively/vibrant atmosphere and includes an array of independent street cafes, bars and restaurants.  There are a variety of local shops catering for day to day requirements including the popular award winning Barbakan delicatessen and the Unicorn (Manchester's co-operative grocery).Each house has parking for two vehicles and Whalley Range has good road connections to Manchester city centre and Manchester Airport. Jordan Fishwick is favored with the sole agents instructions of this well-appointed three story Victorian building with basement, The property is currently operating as a H.M.O. making this an ideal investment property, there is potential to reconfigure it back into a family residence of as these properties are typically 5 bedroom with the potential of developing the basement area for additional square footage. The property is situated in the heart of Chorlton and is moments away from beech avenue with its array of independent bars/cafes/restaurants and Chorlton Park. The Metro link station is close by offering easy access to media city and Manchester city center.

This superb six bedroom detached property is nestled at the end of an electric gated driveway just off Bury New Rd. Whilst being within easy walking distance of all the bars, shops, restaurants and places of worship that Prestwich has to offer it is in a secluded private spot next to Barnfield Park.The property has been greatly improved and lovingly maintained by the current owners and will make a superb family home for the lucky new owners. The accommodation on offer comprises briefly a porch, hallway, downstairs W.C, spacious top of the range kitchen with breakfast bar, dining room with sliding doors opening onto the private rear garden, larger than expected lounge with a conservatory just off it.. To the first floor are three double bedrooms, a good single which is currently used as an office, a family bathroom and unusually a sauna. To the second floor are two further well proportioned bedrooms and a shower room. Externally the property has private low maintenance gardens which get the sun all day long, there is parking to the front for several vehicles.For more information or to arrange a viewing please contact the office.

Exceptionally rare opportunity to purchase this vastly extended and extensively improved detached family residence on the sought-after street of Alexandra Road in Heaton Norris. Leaving little to be desired inside and out with a large rear garden, double-storey rear and a side extension, the property is in a ‘turn-key’ condition set in the heart of a coveted residential area that is especially attractive to growing families, particularly with the popular Norris Bank Primary School just around the corner. Internal inspections are considered essential to appreciate the accommodation on offer with early viewings highly recommended to avoid disappointment. Alexandra Road is ideally situated in the heart of the popular residential area of Heaton Norris, which is highly regarded for its reputable local schools, green spaces and excellent transport links via the M60 Ring Road and A6 into Manchester. The property also has easy access to Heaton Moor Road via Green Lane, which promises a wealth of bars, pubs, and retail outlets. Entering through the front porch, the ground floor is briefly comprised of: large entrance hallway with understairs storage, versatile snug/play room to the front with characteristic bay window, living room area to the rear that could serve a variety of other purposes too, a separate utility area plumbed-in, a partially-tiled downstairs shower room consisting of a white three-piece suite including a walk-in shower. Surely the main highlight of this property is the immaculate open-plan T-shaped kitchen/family room to the rear that features stunning granite worktops, shaker-style units, breakfast bar, a range of integrated appliances and is well lit by a dual aspect window/skylight combination with bi-fold doors leading directly onto the rear garden.Turning stairs to the first floor landing which grants access to all upstairs rooms, including five well-proportioned bedrooms that feature four comfortable doubles and a versatile smaller room to the front currently used as an office/work-from-home space. The two rear bedrooms enjoy particularly idyllic views to the back of the home adding to the appeal of this family home. The family bathroom completes the floor with modern tiling, a four-piece suite including a free-standing bath, and a useful integrated cupboard for storage.Externally, there is ample opportunity to the front for off-street parking on the larger-than-average driveway. To the rear, the delightful garden is two tiered across modern paving and a lawn that enjoys the sun in varying parts through the day. The property backs on to a large open green space, adding to the appeal of this well-appointed home.

An EXQUISITE SEMI-DETACHED FAMILY HOME, which has been FULLY REFURBISHED to an EXCEPTIONALLY HIGH STANDARD, with STYLISH PRESENTATION throughout, located within walking distance of the highly SOUGHT AFTER HEATON MOOR VILLAGE. 1922 sq ft. The accommodation has been modernised to a high standard just five years ago, and offers a DOUBLE STOREY EXTENSION, NEW WINDOWS AND PATIO DOORS, full rewire, new boiler and new roof. Occupying a SIZEABLE position at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac, the property backs onto The Heatons Sports Club offering stunning views from the rear aspect. Internally, the property comprises of: entrance hall, living room, study, open plan sitting room/dining room, large family kitchen/breakfast room and downstairs WC. The first floor reveals five well-proportioned bedrooms, two of which benefit from a new, shower room ensuite. All bedrooms are served by a generously sized, four piece family bathroom. Externally, there is a beautifully landscaped SOUTH FACING rear garden, complete with new fencing, AstroTurf lawn and views over The Heatons Sports Club fields. To the front there is a NEW DRIVE, offering ample off road parking for two vehicles.

We have been advised by the vendors that the property is Freehold.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

A BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED, EXTENDED SEMI DETACHED home, offering WELL BALANCED ACCOMMODATION, situated at the HEAD OF A QUIET CUL DE SAC within WALKING DISTANCE OF DIDSBURY VILLAGE. 1615 sq ft. Call our office today to book a viewing for one of our open days:Wednesday 13th AprilThursday 21st April Friday 22nd Aprillimited slots available, please call our office to arrange your viewing.Having been designed to complement their Victorian neighbours, each of the semi-detached townhouses look, from the outside, like a home typical of the period. Inside, however, it?s a different story. Whilst most period homes present a sequence of small rooms with a determined use, these beautiful new townhouses yield circa 1100 sq ft of stylish and light-filled living accommodation that flows seamlessly from one space to another. Through the front door a large living room progresses through a dedicated dining area to a vast kitchen at the rear. Large bi-fold doors enable the internal living areas to be extended out onto a rear dining patio and garden. A ground floor WC is incorporated beneath a split-level staircase off the living room. On the first floor are two large double bedrooms, one of which enjoys an en suite shower room, along with a family bathroom. On the second floor is a luxurious main bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and en suite. There is also a useful eaves storage space.

A SUBTANTIAL, FOUR DOUBLE BEDROOM SEMI DETACHED property with SOLAR PANELS, which has been thoughtfully EXTENDED and MODERNISED throughout creating a EXCEPTIONAL FAMILY HOME. Located within strolling distance of DIDSBURY VILLAGE, Fletcher Moss Park and both the train and Metrolink stations at East Didsbury. 1428 sq ft. The living accommodation briefly comprises of: entrance porch, hallway with downstairs WC/cloaks, sitting room with bay window and an open plan & extended family living kitchen with bi-fold doors to the rear garden. The first floor reveals four double bedrooms bedrooms with an ensuite to the master bedroom and a stylish four piece family bathroom. Externally the property has OFF ROAD PARKING to the front, whilst to the rear is a fully ENCLOSED LANDSCAPED GARDEN.A magnificent, substantial semi-detached property which has been thoughtfully extended and modernised throughout creating an exceptional family home benefiting from solar panels with 12 years left on the feed in tariff. Positioned on a popular residential road, located within strolling distance of Didsbury village, Fletcher Moss Park, both the train and Metro link stations at East Didsbury as well as being within the catchment area of popular primary and secondary schools. Extending to an impressive 1428 sq ft the beautifully presented accommodation consists of: a porch, entrance hallway with stairs to the first floor, under stairs storage and a downstairs WC/cloaks. There is a bright and spacious sitting room with a large bay window to the front aspect. To the rear is the spectacular open plan family living kitchen, which is flooded with natural light via two skylights and bi-folding doors which open to the attractive rear garden. Within the family living kitchen is ample space for a table and chairs, suitable for both dining and entertaining. The kitchen area is fitted with a comprehensive range of stylish wall and base units, complemented by granite work surfaces over and integrated appliances including: two double ovens, a dishwasher, wine fridge, a five ring gas hob and microwave, as well as having space for a washing machine and an American fridge/freezer. The first floor reveals a generously sized master bedroom with a contemporary en suite shower room, three further double bedrooms, two of which have ample space for freestanding furniture with the fourth bedroom benefiting from fitted wardrobes. The property is served by a stunning four piece family bathroom, providing a bath, walk-in double shower, vanity wash basin and a WC. Externally the property is approached via a block paved driveway providing ample off road parking. Whilst to the rear is a fully enclosed, private landscaped garden, laid with artificial lawn and a patio area providing a perfect space for entertainment and al fresco dining.

AMAZING THREE / FOUR BEDROOM DETACHED HOUSEABSOLUTE PRISTINE CONDITION THROUGHOUTDEFINITELY ONE FOR THE VIEWING LIST We are extremely pleased to have taken instruction in the marketing of this beautifully presented detached house which offers deceptively spacious accommodation with a potential of four very generous double bedrooms and two of them having the advantage of en-suite facilities. The property is situated at the start of Prestwich Park Road South, just off Bury New Road, and is extremely convenient for many amenities:  The village centre with its increasingly eclectic mix of bars, cafes and restaurants together with its many independent and corporate retailers is only a short walk away. The metrolink has its nearest station in the village centre and Manchester City Centre is about 15 minutes away and is easily accessibly by either car, bus or tram. For those needing to travel further afield, the M60/M62/M66 motorway networks are all on the Prestwich/Whitefield border at jct 17 of the M60. There are gardens to both the front and rear of the property, and as the property occupies an elevated position the front garden is tiered from the pavement upto the front door with a paved footpath connecting the two, the garden itself, is well stocked and maintained. To the right hand side of the garden is a detached double garage with a 'remote control operated' sectional rollover door to the front and a separate access door to its rear, which leads to the side of the property. We are informed that the garage benefits from a power, lighting and water supply and also has a mezzanine style floor internally which is ideal for storage. In recent years the property has been substantially upgraded, with most rooms having been replastered, skimmed and redecorated, all three bathrooms and the kitchen have been refurbished and all the external barge boards, soffats, downpipes and gutters have been replaced in plastic. The property is heated by gas central heating and is fully double glazed throughout. As you access the property through the front door the accommodation is as follows: You are straight into the reception hall and to the right hand side, are three doors which give you access to, first of all, the first of the double bedrooms with its fitted furniture to two elevations and patio doors with a juliette balcony overlooking the front garden, the next door leads you into the well equipped utility room, which houses the central heating boiler, is plumbed for a washing machine and vented for a dryer. The last of the three doors takes you into the partially tiled family shower room with its wc and wash hand basin in white and a separate walk in shower enclosure. There is also a built in cloaks cupboard adjacent to the shower room. On the opposite, left hand side of the hallway is the first of two doors, which will take you into a lovely spacious lounge area, with its feature hole in the wall gas fire and its patio doors to the front, the lounge opens into the dining room where you will find another set of patio doors overlooking the front garden. All the rooms at the front of the property have the advantage of large patio doors leading out into the garden. From the dining room there is access through to the spacious kitchen at the rear, which is fitted with grey fascia'd base and wall storage units, complimenting worktops and an inset sink unit there is an integrated 'range' style gas cooker with an extraction unit above which is to be included. To the rear right hand side of the kitchen is a door that returns you back into the lounge. At the rear left hand side of the property is the largest of the bedrooms, and its certainly not the size you would expect, at nearly 7 metres in length, it has a lengthy run of quality furniture to one wall and to the opposite side is its en-suite bathroom, which has fully tiled walls and floor and inset downlights into the ceiling. It boasts a modern four piece suite in white, with a shower over the bath.  The next and final room on this floor is currently used as an office, but dependent on your circumstances would be ideal as either the fourth reception area or fourth bedroom and at over 14 sq meters, could certainly be classed as a double room. Like the majority of the rooms on this floor it also has patio doors, which lead out to the conservatory at the rear, which in turn has a door leading out into the garden. To the rear right hand side of the reception hall is the staircase which now takes you to the next floor, formerley the loft and with all the necessary building regs approval, this is now another substantially sized double bedroom with vellux rooflights to the pitched ceiling, it has an en-suite shower room with a white suite and step in corner shower enclosure and to the far side of the bedroom is an adjoining room which would be ideal as either a dressing room, home office or perhaps even a nursery. Sometimes words and photographs do not give full credit to the property and we feel that this property certainly falls into that category, consequently we would recommend contacting the office and making an early appointment to view as we are confident this property will not be on the market for long.

If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

A fantastic extended semi-detached family home located close to local transport link, amenities and schools. This four bedroom property has been maintained to a high standard and is perfect for a family. The property briefly comprises; Spacious entrance hallway with storage and wc, family room with bay window, a spacious open plan lounge / dining room with feature fireplace and patio doors leading out onto the rear garden, plus a fantastic kitchen diner with side access. The first floor offers four well-proportioned bedrooms, two with fitted wardrobes, a family bathroom and separate shower room, the property also benefits from a useful loft space. Externally the property is set back from the road with off road parking for a couple of vehicles and is set on a lovely plot. Viewing highly recommended to appreciate this lovely home.

Surrounded by local parks and green space, shops and amenities, and with Levenshulme Train Station just a short 7 minute walk away; Poplar Villa is perfectly situated for anyone looking to make the most of what the area has to offer.As you walk up the path to this lovely double fronted family home, you are surrounded by private front and side gardens with laid to lawn areas, children's barked play area and ample space for seating and entertaining outdoors. Internally, the property briefly comprises of: bright entrance hall with high ceilings leading in to the lounge with dual aspect windows, bay window and feature fireplace with surround. Off the hall, a separate versatile snug which is currently used as a home office/second sitting room, with built in shelving to the alcoves and hardwood flooring. Down the hall, a fabulous family kitchen/diner with a range of wall and base units and space for appliances. The exposed brick chimney breast adds character and a homely feel to the space. Off the kitchen, a downstairs shower room and utility with corner shower, sink, WC and space for white goods. Access down to the cellar with three chambers. The rear courtyard provides the perfect private outdoor space to enjoy the sunshine with unobscured views.To the first floor: three extremely well proportioned double bedrooms, all providing ample space for king size bed and wardrobe space. The master bedroom also boasts dual aspect windows, allowing the light to flood in. The main family bathroom has been tastefully refurbished and benefits from three piece suite with shower over the bath.Having been lovingly renovated by it's current owners, this immaculately presented unique home offers period features throughout with a modern twist. A viewing is highly recommended to appreciate the accommodation on offer.

Ryder and Dutton are delighted to bring 'The Fairway Views' to the market. The brand new development consists of 8 spacious 4 bedroomed townhouses, split into two blocks of 4 homes. All of the houses have been designed to a high specification throughout. 'The Fairway Views' is situated within the charming area of Wodhouses, which is located in the town of Oldham. Each property has fantastic views of the Brookdale Golf Club to the rear, which the spacious gardens back directly on to. The property specification includes a fully fitted kitchen with high end intergrated appliances such as; a fridge/freezer, oven, hob and extractor fan, along with a dishwasher and washer/dryer. There is an instant boiling water tap, as a standard, for that extra luxury finish. The kitchen has a feature of a roof lantern, which offers additional light into the kitchen. All bathrooms will be decorated to a high standard and will be fully tiled, with heated towel rails. There is a choice of floor coverings and other 'extras' to enable buyers to bespoke their new home. For more information, please contact Ryder and Dutton, Land and New Homes on  .

SET WITHIN WORSLEY CONSERVATION AREA  AND OFFERED AS FREEHOLD, STUNNING PERIOD FEATURES, SET OVER THREE FLOORS, TWO RECEPTION ROOMS, REAR FACING CONSERVATORY, NOT OVERLOOKED TO THE REAR, MASTER BEDROOM WITH SHOWER ENSUITE, FIVE PIECE FAMILY BATHROOM, CLOSE TO MOTORWAY NETWORKS TO MANCHESTER CITY CENTRE/SALFORD QUAYS/MEDIA CITYBoasting stunning features including wooden beams to the ceiling and exposed brick walls this stunning and historic two bedroomed cottage offers a versatile living space over three floors. Situated on prestigious Mill Brow, Worsley the property was historically known as a home for 'waifs and strays'. Briefly comprising of a front accessed entrance hall with hand sink and guest w.c situated to the far side. Three exposed brick steps lead to the first reception room situated on the ground floor and currently utilised as the main lounge whilst fitted with a feature fireplace and inset gas fire. A second reception room to the rear elevation allows access to the kitchen via a feature stone and exposed brick staircase to the lower ground floor. Fitted with wooden wall and base units the kitchen/diner allows space for appliances and continues to a brick built conservatory with apex roof and double Upvc doors. Via an oak and glass feature staircase, the first floor landing allows access to the loft space via a hatch in the ceiling, the vendor advises that the sizeable loft allows for standing room and could offer the potential for further scope. The master bedroom benefits from built-in storage and a shower en suite, a second double bedroom is situated to the front elevation. The family bathroom is fitted with a five-piece suite comprising of a corner spa bath, shower unit, w.c and two hand wash basins. Externally, the property provides on-road parking to the front whilst the rear of the property remains not over looked with views over Worsley woods, whilst allowing for a lawn with borders and decorative stone patio area. Worsley Village, situated well for access to Manchester City Centre, Salford Quays and Media City, offers a selection of bars, restaurants and a tea room. Locally you will find The Marriott Hotel and Country Club with golf course, a firm favourite of many.

Entering through the ground floor, the property itself is briefly comprised of: cosey living room to the front with exposed brickwork in the chimney breast with a log-burning fire and characteristic floor tiling, a contemporary shaker-style kitchen in-keeping with the rustic feel of the property featuring fitted units, cupboards, and cupboards, which leads directly onto the impeccable garden room in the extension to the rear that opens directly out onto the rear garden with bi-folding doors, which is west-facing and enjoys sun through the afternoon.To the first floor, there is a comfortable double bedroom to the front boasting original floorboards, fireplace and large windows/high ceilings allowing for a light and airy feel, with a family bathroom to the rear comprised of a modern four-piece suite including a walk-in shower. To the top floor, the second bedroom includes exposed beams and a fireplace adding to the charm of the room which is well-lit by a skylight. To the cellar, there is a useable space with electric that could function as a work-from-home space or merely as extra storage. Externally, the rear garden is comprised of a mixture of decking and lawn making for a wonderful space to enjoy the summer months especially with it being west-facing and enjoying the sun through the day. A shed to the end of the plot also offers further opportunity for storage.

A fantastic opportunity to acquire this chain free home which occupies a hugely desirable corner plot position on this popular residential road.  Close to excellent transport links into Manchester and with Didsbury village within easy reach, this home is bound to appeal to small families and professional couples and is an ideal blank canvass.  With a large driveway frontage, it also benefits from a second driveway positioned behind the garden with a gate giving access.The accommodation comprises an entrance hallway with a useful understairs storage cupboard, the bay fronted lounge which now opens through to the dining room with a feature fire surround and double doors opening to the rear garden.  The generous kitchen is fitted with a comprehensive range of floor and wall units and houses an integrated oven, 5 ring gas hob and extractor hood, and provides space for a dishwasher, fridge, freezer and washing machine.On the first floor the landing leads to 3 well proportioned bedrooms and an attractive family bathroom.Externally the property makes the most of its corner position with generous gardens to both the rear and side of the house.  There is a driveway frontage, and the second driveway accessed from around the corner with gate through to the rear of the garden.

Clive Anthony are pleased to offer for sale this extended, three bedroom semi detached property being situated on the popular Winchester Avenue in Prestwich. This home briefly comprises; entrance hall, spacious lounge, dining room, morning room, kitchen, three bedrooms and a bathroom. There is a front driveway and garden as well as a rear courtyard. The property is well situated for local shops, schools, public transport links and with easy access into Prestwich Village and onto the motorway networks. An early viewing is strongly advised as properties in this location are in high demand. Ground FloorThe entrance hallway has a stairway leading to the first floor landing and provides access to the lounge and morning room. The spacious lounge provides ample space for lounge furniture, has a double glazed bay window with front views and feature fireplace. The morning room allows space for a table with chairs, allows space for an undercounter freezer and houses the floor mounted boiler. It also provides access to the kitchen and dining room. The modern kitchen includes a range matching wall and base units with co-ordinating work surfaces, sink with mixer tap, ‘Baumatic’ electric oven/grill, five ring gas hob with extractor above, allows space for a washing machine, dishwasher and under counter fridge. The dining room allows ample space for a dining table with chairs, has a feature wood/coal burning fireplace and a doorway that leads out to the rear courtyard. First FloorThe landing provides access to the three bedrooms and the bathroom. The master bedroom is a large double room with fitted wardrobes and a feature bay window. The second double bedroom allows space for freestanding bedroom furniture and has a double glazed window. The third bedroom allows space for freestanding furniture and has a double glazed window with rear views. The bathroom comprises of a corner bath, walk in shower enclosure with plumbed in shower, low level w.c, pedestal hand wash basin, fully tiled walls with complementary flooring and a frosted window. OutsideTo the front there is a driveway and garden, access can be gained down the side of the property to a rear courtyard. Additional InformationWe have been informed the property is Freehold with a chief ground rent of £5 per annum ( subject to solicitors confirmation)Council Tax Band CThe loft is accessed off Bedroom three which has a retractable ladder, is boarded and has lighting. It also houses the water tank.Gas central heating with radiators throughout provided by the boiler which is located in the morning room.

We are extremely pleased to have taken instruction in the sale of this traditional 1930's three bedroomed semi detached property which is situated in this extremely popular residential location, close to Heywood Road and Bury Old Road. Right in the heart of Monton village lies this gorgeous three-bed terraced house with the added bonus of a converted loft room, ideal for a guest suite or home office. Front walled lawned garden, shared side access to the rear, spacious rear south facing garden with paved and lawned areas, garden shed ideal for storage.Tenure - The vendor has confirmed the property is Leasehold with a term over 999 years remaining and a yearly payment of £5.00Stamp Duty - In England and Northern Ireland you're liable to pay Stamp Duty when you buy a residential property, or a piece of land, costing more than £125,000 (or more than £40,000 for second homes).This tax applies to both freehold and leasehold properties  whether you're buying outright or with a mortgage.ExampleIf you buy a house for £275,000, the SDLT you owe is calculated as follows:0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £25,000 = £1,250Total SDLT = £3,750Buyers of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties, will have to pay an extra 3% in Stamp Duty on top of current rates for each band.This increased rate applies to properties bought for £40,000 or more.FIRST TIME BUYER RELIEF If you're a first-time buyer in England or Northern Ireland, you will pay no Stamp Duty on properties worth up to £300,000. For properties costing up to £500,000, you will pay no Stamp Duty on the first £300,000. You will pay Stamp Duty on the remaining amount, up to £200,000. If the property you are buying is worth over £500,000, you will pay the standard rates of Stamp Duty and will not qualify for first-time buyer's relief.Higher rates for additional propertiesFrom 1 April 2016, you will usually have to pay 3% on top of the normal SDLT rates if buying a new residential property means you will own more than one.You wont pay the extra 3% SDLT if the property you are buying is replacing your main residence and that has already been sold.**IN LINE WITH THE CURRENT GOVERNMENT GUIDELINES THE PROPERTY IS CURRENTLY EXEMPT FROM STAMP DUTY TIL MARCH 2021 SUBJECT TO PERSONAL CIRCUMSTANCES**

The vendors have advised us that the property is FreeholdStamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

BATHROOM: Bath/wc combined with a 3 piece white suite and electric shower. BEDROOM 1: A double bedroom to the front of the property. BEDROOM 2: A double bedroom to the rear of the property. Fabulous large and well stocked garden to the rear.The garden is larger than average and has an array of seating areas and shed. Auction Method: The auction for this property will take place as an "Auction Event" behind closed doors with a live auctioneer and will be streamed online in real-time. The property will be sold alongside several other lots. Bids must be placed remotely please see the below section on "Registration Process". The auction can be watched in real-time on the auction date through SDL Property Auctions' website on their home page. The auction date applicable for the property is displayed underneath the property description. It is not possible to provide a precise timeslot when this property will be auctioned on the day, because there are other lots being sold. You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be processed. When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to SDL Property Auctions' Buyers Terms (England & Wales) which are available on SDL Property Auctions website.  Auction type - Unconditional with Variable Fee If you are the highest bidder, you must exchange legally binding contracts for the sale when the auction for the property comes to an end. You must then pay the applicable fees and deposit. You must complete the sale within 15 business days unless the Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack state otherwise.  Auction Fees The following non-refundable fees apply: Buyer's Fee- payable on exchange of contracts. This is calculated as a percentage of the actual purchase price of the property. Either: (a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000 (b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000 The Buyer's Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Buyer's Fee does not contribute to the purchase price. There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of SDL Property Auctions, and will be in addition to any fees payable to us. SDL Property Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special Conditions of Sale.  Deposit On exchange of contracts, you must pay a non-refundable deposit equal to 5% of the actual purchase price of the property, subject to a minimum of £5,000. The deposit contributes towards the purchase price.  Payment Method: Applicable fees must be paid immediately after a winning bid has been placed. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted. Prior to the auction, you will receive an email from the auctioneer to register your card details with third-party provider, Stripe. Your card details will be stored on their secure online payment platform. Payment will only be taken from you in the event of a winning bid. In this case, you will be contacted by a representative of the auctioneer to make payment. If you cannot be contacted within 24 hours after the auction ends, the auctioneer reserves the right to charge your card.  Legal Pack Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate. The legal pack can be viewed on SDL Property Auctions website by searching for the property. On the property details page there is a sub-heading "Legal Packs". Follow this link, and you will then be directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents. The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most recent version of the legal pack. An addendum may be issued outlining any late changes. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale. It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.  Special Conditions of Sale The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of SDL Property Auctions' terms and conditions. The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to read in the legal pack.  Registration Process: To register to bid on the property, visit the SDL Property Auctions website and submit your remote bid. The lot number can be found against the Lot Details of the property. Prospective buyers must register no later than 12pm the day before the auction date. If you register after the cut-off, it cannot be guaranteed that your registration will be processed.

Welcome to Parrin Lane, where you'll find a beautiful 3 double bedroom, semi-detached gem located just outside Monton Village. A perfect balance between old and new, this period property has been modernised beautifully throughout. The vendor has confirmed the property is Freehold.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

Neighbourhood is a welcoming and diverse community of sustainably designed homes. A collection of ninety-five three-bedroom homes, contemporary in design, each one is built to a high specification. Created by, and for, the environmentally conscious, the homes offer modern-day living space in beautifully fitted surroundings, designed to bring comfort and joy. Neighbourhood continues our commitment to constructing exceptional homes.KEY FEATURESBlock paved driveway with electric car charging points enabled, Privacy screens on driveway, Fully alarmed and security lighting, Bike stores. Three stories, ground floor WC master bedroom with en suite and private roof terrace.All Neighbourhood homes are fitted with superfast broadband, car charging points, air source heat pumps, zonal heating systems, fresh air recycling systems and smart meters.LOCATIONConveniently located, only a five-minute walk to your nearest tram stop opens up fast access to the cities of Salford and Manchester whenever you need it. Schools, colleges and universities make high standards of education available for all ages in your immediate locality. From nurseries and pre-school to academies to sixth-form college and university, children and adults have easy access to their chosen path of learning from nearby Neighbourhood.Your local shops - barbers, convenience stores, florists, pharmacies, eateries and local pubs - are a few minutes’ walk from Neighbourhood. Schools and parks are within a short walking distance. Trams, trains and planes connect you with ease from Neighbourhood to Manchester and the rest of the world. Manchester Airport is 11 miles and a 20 minute drive away.BUYING OPTIONSHELP TO BUYHelp to Buy is a government backed scheme available in England and Wales that allows you to buy a home with just 5% deposit. With Help to Buy, you’ll get an equity loan of up to 20% of the cost of a new home; this is interest free for 5 years. Here’s how the scheme works Deposit 5% Government loan 20% Mortgage 75% You’ll need to obtain a mortgage of at least 75% of the full price of your new home.SHARED OWNERSHIPShared Ownership is part buy and part rent, buy between 25% - 75% of the market price and pay rent on the rest. Who? Everyone! As long as you are employed, have a household income of less than £80k and do not own another property. What would the rent be? You will pay 2.75% rent per annum on the unowned share. For example on £150k, if your mortgage is 50%, your rent would be £172 pcm on the remaining 50% (These are only indicative figures and are subject to market change and mortgage approval).OUTRIGHT OWNERSHIPBuying a new home outright at Neighbourhood? Choose your 100% owned home Reserve your new home with £500 Mortgage approval. Legal process and completion . Generally mortgages are based on a 10% deposit.*

This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction which is not to be confused with traditional auction.VIEW.....PLACE YOUR BID......SECURE YOUR HOME......This superb three bedroom semi-detached property offers a home with buckets of potential and is located within a sought after area of Stretford. We do not require the purchaser to exchange contracts immediately, but grant 28 days to achieve exchange of contracts from the date the buyer's solicitor is in receipt of the draft contracts and a further 28 days thereafter to complete. Allowing the additional time to exchange on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to put down a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 3.5% to a minimum of  £5,000.00 + VAT (£1,000.00) = ( £6,000.00) which secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative. The buyer will be required to sign an Acknowledgement of Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation from and all terms and conditions can be found in the Buyer Information Pack which can be downloaded for free from the auction section of our website or requested from our Auction Department. Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed reserve price which is generally no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid, both the Starting Bid and reserve price can be subject to change. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by North West Property Auction powered by I AM-SOLD Ltd. **REDUCED FOR QUICK SALE**A SPACIOUS WEST FACING ONE BEDROOM RETIREMENT APARTMENT FOR AGED 70 PLUS WITH WALK-OUT BALCONY, SITUATED ON THE THIRD FLOOR WITH LIFT. Broadfield Court was purpose built in 2016 by McCarthy & Stone for retirement living. The development consists of 48 one and two-bedroom retirement living plus apartments for the over 70s and 14 retirement living apartments for the over 60s. There is a CQC registered Estates Manager and team available from 7am until 11pm for help and support on site and a 24-hour emergency call system provided via a personal pendant alarm and with call points throughout. The development includes a Homeowners' lounge and landscaped gardens and an on-site Bistro serving hot food through the day, ideal for meeting new people or entertaining family and friends. There is even a guest suite for visitors who wish to stay (additional charges apply). There is also a useful laundry room and car parking – permit scheme applies, check with the Estate Manager for availability. What The Ower SaysMy Mum moved here from Kent, to be closer to extended family. She found Broadfield Court a welcoming safe and comfy environment to live in and with all the facilities and help available on tap with friendly staff, she felt really pampered.The Bistro was an inviting place for her to meet new people quickly and to receive family and friends. The guest apartment was perfect for visitors who needed to stay over and as a keen gardener in her younger days, she loved sitting in the grounds.My mum hopes the next occupant will be as happy as she was at Broadfield Court. Local Area Broadfield Court is situated in Prestwich, well located close to the shopping precinct and convenience shops on Rectory Lane and Bury New Road. Adjoining this new precinct is Marks & Spencer Simply Food, and close by a large Tesco Extra Supermarket. There are also Sedgley Parks shops, which include a Sainsburys local, Lidl and a Post Office just South of the site. The property is very prominent on Bury New Road, which is one of the main arterial routes in and out of Manchester city centre. The town has some very good residential areas close by including, Prestwich Park, Sedgley Park, Broughton Park and Whitefield. Entrance HallFront door with spy hole leads to the large entrance hall - the 24-hour Tunstall emergency response pull cord system is situated in the hall. From the hallway there is a door to a walk-in storage cupboard/airing cupboard. Illuminated light switches, smoke detector, apartment security door entry system with intercom and emergency pull cord located in the hall. Doors lead to the bedroom, living room and bathroom. LoungeWith walk-out west facing balcony offering pleasant views over the gardens. Feature fireplace with fitted electric fire as an attractive focal point, with door leading onto the walk out balcony offering pleasant views over the gardens .TV and telephone points. Two ceiling lights. Fitted carpets, floor to ceiling curtains, raised electric power sockets. Partially double-glazed doors lead onto a separate kitchen. Some lounge furniture included in the sale.  Kitchen Fully fitted kitchen with tiled floor. Stainless steel sink with mono block lever tap. Built-in oven, ceramic hob with extractor hood and fitted integrated fridge, freezer and under pelmet lighting. Bedroom A large double bedroom which benefits from a walk-in wardrobe. Ceiling lights, TV and phone point. Shower Room Fully tiled and fitted with modern suite comprising of walk-in shower, anti-slip floor, WC, vanity unit with sink and illuminated mirror above. For sale on 31 March 2022 The National Property Auction will be conducted behind closed doors. The auction will be live-streamed online with remote bidding only. Registration for bidding will close at 12pm the day before the auction. The auction will commence at 10:00. ACCOMMODATION HALL LOUNGE/DINING ROOM KITCHEN SHOWEROOM 3 BEDROOMS BATHROOM/WC GARDEN TO THE FRONT AND YARD TO THE REAR GAS CENTRAL HEATING (Not tested) uPVC DOUBLE GLAZED WINDOWS VIEWING DATES 09th March 4.30 - 5.0016th March 9.00 - 9.3023rd March 4.30 - 5.0029th March 9.00 - 9.30Auction Method: The auction for this property will take place as an "Auction Event" behind closed doors with a live auctioneer and will be streamed online in real-time. The property will be sold alongside several other lots. Bids must be placed remotely please see the below section on "Registration Process". The auction can be watched in real-time on the auction date through SDL Property Auctions' website on their home page. The auction date applicable for the property is displayed underneath the property description. It is not possible to provide a precise timeslot when this property will be auctioned on the day, because there are other lots being sold. You are required to undertake identity checks before you can be authorised to bid. You must also provide your payment details. If you do not provide this information, your registration will not be processed. When you place your bid, you are deemed to have agreed to SDL Property Auctions' Buyers Terms (England & Wales) which are available on SDL Property Auctions website.  Auction type - Unconditional with Variable Fee If you are the highest bidder, you must exchange legally binding contracts for the sale when the auction for the property comes to an end. You must then pay the applicable fees and deposit. You must complete the sale within 15 business days unless the Special Conditions of Sale contained within the Legal Pack state otherwise.  Auction Fees The following non-refundable fees apply: Buyer's Fee- payable on exchange of contracts. This is calculated as a percentage of the actual purchase price of the property. Either: (a) 4.8% (including VAT) of the purchase price, for properties up to and including £250,000 (b) 3.6% (including VAT) of the purchase price for properties sold for over £250,000 The Buyer's Fee is subject always to a minimum of £6,000 (including VAT). The Buyer's Fee does not contribute to the purchase price. There may be additional fees listed in the Special Conditions of Sale, which will be available to view within the Legal Pack. You must read the Special Conditions carefully before bidding. Any additional fees are included at the seller's discretion, not on the instruction of SDL Property Auctions, and will be in addition to any fees payable to us. SDL Property Auctions has limited control over the content of the Special Conditions of Sale.  Deposit On exchange of contracts, you must pay a non-refundable deposit equal to 5% of the actual purchase price of the property, subject to a minimum of £5,000. The deposit contributes towards the purchase price.  Payment Method: Applicable fees must be paid immediately after a winning bid has been placed. Payment by cash or cheque will not be accepted. Prior to the auction, you will receive an email from the auctioneer to register your card details with third-party provider, Stripe. Your card details will be stored on their secure online payment platform. Payment will only be taken from you in the event of a winning bid. In this case, you will be contacted by a representative of the auctioneer to make payment. If you cannot be contacted within 24 hours after the auction ends, the auctioneer reserves the right to charge your card.  Legal Pack Before bidding, you must view the legal pack for the property. This is the collection of legal documents that apply to the sale. The documents will include but are not limited to: Special Conditions of Sale, title documents from the Land Registry and Energy Performance Certificate. The legal pack can be viewed on SDL Property Auctions website by searching for the property. On the property details page there is a sub-heading "Legal Packs". Follow this link, and you will then be directed to create an account with Auction Passport to view the documents. The legal pack can change at any time up until the auction starts so you must check for the most recent version of the legal pack. An addendum may be issued outlining any late changes. At the point of placing your bid, you are deemed to have read the legal pack in its entirety, including any changes. Failure to check for changes to the legal pack will not be a valid reason for withdrawing from the sale. It is strongly recommended that you instruct a qualified professional to review the legal pack and raise any necessary enquiries before bidding.  Special Conditions of Sale The property is sold subject to any Special Conditions of Sale. These are contractual conditions that are included by the seller of the property - they are not part of SDL Property Auctions' terms and conditions. The Special Conditions of Sale are legally binding. You are taken to have read and accepted these at the point of bidding, even if you have not done so. The Special Conditions of Sale are available to read in the legal pack.  Registration Process: To register to bid on the property, visit the SDL Property Auctions website and submit your remote bid. The lot number can be found against the Lot Details of the property. Prospective buyers must register no later than 12pm the day before the auction date. If you register after the cut-off, it cannot be guaranteed that your registration will be processed.

Viewings highly recommend to appreciate this loved family home.Entrance Porch - 0.74m x 1.35m (2'5 x 4'5) - Entrance porch leading to hallHall - Carpeted, stairs off, window to top of stairs, door leading into lounge.Lounge - 3.15m x 4.04m (10'4 x 13'3) - Front facing into bow window, carpeted, feature electric fire, radiator, tv point, under stairs storage cupboardKitchen/Diner - 3.78m x 5.00m (12'5 x 16'5) - Rear facing with window and vertical blinds, modern range of fitted wall and base units in Grey finish with complimentary wooden worktops. Inset sink and drainer with mixer taps over, built in single electric oven and gas hob with extractor hood over, tiled splashback, laminate flooring, plumbing for washer, spotlights, built in storage cupboard, neutral decor, patio doors to rear garden with vertical blinds.Stairs - Leading not all first floor rooms, carpeted, window to top of stairsBedroom 1 - 2.74m x 3.10m (9'0 x 10'2) - Front facing into bow window, carpeted, radiator, tv point, shelving, neutral decor.Bedroom 2 - 2.95m x 3.10m (9'8 x 10'2) - Rear facing window with vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, tv point, shelving, neutral decor.Bedroom 3 - 2.06m x 1.80m (6'9 x 5'11) - Rear facing window with vertical blinds, carpeted, radiator, tv point, boiler.Family Bathroom - 1.52m x 1.80m (5 x 5'11) - Front facing with window, three piece bathroom suite in white comprising of sink, toilet and bath withy shower over, radiator, partly tiled walls, vinyl flooringExternally - Front driveway for 2 cars and paved path, gated side access to private rear garden with split level decked area.Tenure - The vendors have confirmed the property is Leasehold for 999 years starting from July 1942 with a Ground Rent of £5.00pa.Stamp Duty - You must pay Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT) if you buy a property or land over a certain price in England and Northern Ireland.You pay the tax when you:•buy a freehold property•buy a new or existing leasehold•buy a property through a shared ownership scheme•are transferred land or property in exchange for payment, for example you take on a mortgage or buy a share in a houseThe threshold is where SDLT starts to apply. If you buy a property for less than the threshold, there’s no SDLT to pay.The current SDLT threshold for residential properties is £125,000.The threshold for non-residential land and properties is £150,000.Thresholds Up to £125,000 – 0%£125,000 (the portion from £125,001 to £250,000) – 2%£625,000 (the portion from £250,001 to £935,000) – 5%ExampleIn October 2021 you buy a house for £295,000.  The SDLT you owe will be calculated as follows:-0% on the first £125,000 = £02% on the next £125,000 = £2,5005% on the final £45,000 = £2,250Total SDLT = £4,750First-time buyers:From 1 July 2021, you’ll get a discount (relief) that means you’ll pay less or no tax if both the following apply:•you, and anyone else you’re buying with, are first-time buyers•the purchase price is £500,000 or lessYou’ll also be eligible for this discount if you bought your first home before 8 July 2020.How much you pay depends on whether the land or property is residential use or non-residential or mixed-use.If you’re buying a residential property there are different rates of SDLT if:•you’re a first-time buyer•you already own a property and you’re buying an additional property•you’re not a UK residentYou can use HM Revenue and Customs’ (HMRC) Stamp Duty Land Tax calculator to work out how much tax you’ll pay.You may be able to reduce the amount of tax you pay by claiming relief, such as if you’re a first-time buyer or purchasing more than one property (‘multiple dwellings’).

The mill overlooks Houldsworth Golf Course, providing panoramic views across wide green spaces and our urban village.Elisabeth Gardens is a stunning marriage of history and contemporary living in the heart of Reddish’s Houldsworth conservation area. Based just over five miles out of the city centre, Elisabeth Gardens offers the perfect suburban environment for those looking for the advantages of city life whilst remaining out of the hustle and bustle of the central district. For those wishing to see what the city has to offer, the centre is only a few steps away on one of the many excellent local transport links.This up-and-coming urban village in the South-East of Manchester, sits in the perfect location for young professionals and families to make their home in the city that is the Northern Powerhouse. The development has been carefully constructed with community at its heart; there are several public and private gardens for residents to enjoy as well as recreational areas and allotments.Key Highlights: *   Located in Reddish, Stockport, SK5 6FW *   10 Minutes from Reddish South Station *   5 Minutes from Local Shopping Centers *   2 Minutes from Houldsworth Golf Club *   Ready to move-in *   Golf course views in Houldsworth Conservation area. *   Remaining Units starting from £163,000 *   Only 25% down payment *   1- & 2-Bedroom Apartments *   ONLY 9 UNITS remaining *   2 and 3 bed townhouses (4 beds SOLD OUT) *   Stunning Mill Conversion with exposed brickwork *   High Quality Finish Throughout *   Communal residents’ space *   Close to local amenities and schools *   Great Transport LinksThe grand red brick architecture of Elisabeth Mill, with its imposing fac ade and expansive windows, presents the perfect perspective for stunning one and two-bedroom apartments equipped for today’s discerning purchasers.
